title: Sikh leaders in Pakistan urge India to lift ban on pilgrims travelling to Guru Nanak’s shrine
description: The Central government has denied permission for Sikhs to cross into Pakistan for Guru Nanak’s birth anniversary, citing security concerns

title: Karnataka government releases ₹125 crore to newly-formed corporations in Bengaluru
description: The new corporations have been established under the Greater Bengaluru Administration Act, 2024 through a government notification issued on September 2, 2025.

title: BMW crash: No bail for accused Gaganpreet; bus, ambulance also guilty, says lawyer
description: A Delhi court rejected bail for Gaganpreet Makkad, the accused in the BMW accident case involving the death of Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody is extended until September 27. Makkad's lawyer highlighted the delayed FIR and questioned the culpable homicide charge. The defense also raised concerns about a DTC bus and ambulance inaction.

title: Malaika Arora says she’s judged for her career, clothes and relationships; called ‘too bold, too outspoken’: ‘I felt free when…’
Google launches payments protocol for agentic AI transactions
description: The initiative is already supported by more than 60 partners including fintech companies like Revolut, Coinbase and Paypal to merchants and SaaS companies like Etsy, Salesforce and Inuit to financial providers like American Express and Mastercard

title: UPSC aspirants’ meet in Bengaluru on September 22
description: The event will be held from 11 a.m. to 12.30 p.m.

title: Supreme Court reverses 2022 verdict on Haryana village common lands, restores proprietors’ rights
description: Allowing the plea seeking review of its own judgement, a Bench comprising Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and K.V. Viswanathan set aside the 2022 verdict

title: The void between India and Pakistan is not just in skills, but also the way they train
description: Watching India and Pakistan train in Dubai highlighted the gulf between the two sides. India’s discipline, punctuality and structured sessions contrasted starkly with Pakistan’s disorganised approach. While Indian batters endured rigorous drills under coaches, Pakistan turned to casual football and trial-and-error practice — mirroring their struggles on the field.

title: Gourangalal Das to be India's new Envoy to South Korea
description: Das played a key role in the negotiations between India and China to rebuild their ties that came under severe strain following the over four-year-long eastern Ladakh border standoff

title: Varun Chakravarthy becomes No.1 T20I bowler in ICC rankings for first time
description: Left-arm spinner Kuldeep Yadav has made a significant leap, jumping 16 places to 23rd, while spin all-rounder Axar Patel has moved up one place to 12th.

description: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh extended an invitation to BlackBuck's CEO Rajesh Yabaji to relocate the company to Visakhapatnam, following Yabaji's announcement of leaving Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road due to severe commuting issues. This move has ignited concerns within Bengaluru's IT sector regarding governance and infrastructure, prompting calls for government intervention to address deteriorating road conditions and public utilities.

title: Roads gone, patients stranded, hotels open doors for free: Mussoorie cut off as floods hit Dehradun
'Why you asking for my wife's number': Foreign tourist confronts man in Amritsar - watch
description: A video from Amritsar shows a foreign tourist confronting a local man for inappropriately asking his wife for her phone number. The tourist questioned the man's behavior, deeming it "strange." Social media users expressed frustration, sharing similar experiences of harassment faced by women in India. One user recounted incidents of strangers incessantly requesting photos with his girlfriend.

title: Punjab State Dear Diwali Bumper Lottery 2025: Draw Date, Results, winning amount, process and other details
Behind Canva’s bid for lead sponsorship of Indian cricket team: Focus on 4th largest market by user base
GST rate cuts: FM says reforms to inject Rs 2L cr; claims 'people will have cash in hand'
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that GST rate cuts, effective September 22, are expected to inject Rs 2 lakh crore into the economy. Post-reform, most items have shifted to lower tax brackets. Companies are reportedly reducing rates, passing benefits to consumers.

description: The Aam Aadmi Party has escalated the India-Pakistan handshake controversy, with leader Saurabh Bharadwaj challenging Suryakumar Yadav and the BCCI. Bharadwaj urged them to donate match earnings to the Pahalgam terror attack victims' widows.

'Our soldiers brought Pak to its knees': PM Modi reacts to JeM commander's video; hails Op Sindoor
description: Prime Minister Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday in Madhya Pradesh, lauded Operation Sindoor's success, citing a Jaish-e-Muhammed commander's video confession. The commander admitted the operation devastated Maulana Masood Azhar's family and JeM's Bahawalpur headquarters on May 7. Modi asserted that this "new India" fears no threats and strikes within enemy territory, prioritizing national security after Pakistani terrorists harmed Indian citizens.

title: 'Action will be taken': IPL chairman on PCB's complaint; clarifies ICC will review
description: Following a handshake controversy during the Asia Cup clash, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) lodged a complaint against match referee Andy Pycroft, requesting his removal. While the ICC rejected the initial appeal, Pycroft has been "rested" for Pakistan's upcoming match.

‘Severe pain’: India’s exports to US fall drastically on Trump’s 50% tariffs; check details
description: India's exports to the US have been declining for three consecutive months, with August experiencing a significant 16.3% drop due to increased tariffs imposed by the US. The impact is uneven, heavily affecting sectors like apparel and gems, potentially leading to substantial export losses and job cuts.

PM Modi turns 75: Trump dials 'friend', Meloni posts selfie; wishes pour in
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday with global leaders extending their heartfelt wishes, acknowledging his leadership and India's growing global influence. US President Donald Trump, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, and New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon lauded PM Modi's friendship and vision. Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also conveyed their greetings, emphasising strong bilateral ties.

title: 'Priyanka Chopra had bad skin, she is big-boned': Prahlad Kakkar lauds actress
description: Priyanka Chopra's journey from a pageant winner to a Bollywood star and then to Hollywood is lauded by adman Prahlad Kakkar. He reveals that she overcame disadvantages like her complexion and build with hard work and determination. Kakkar praises her ambition, focus, and dignity, especially regarding her personal life, highlighting her resilience in restarting her career in a new industry.

title: Azim Premji Foundation Scholarship 2025: Here’s how to apply for scholarships worth Rs 30,000

Patna high court orders Congress to remove AI video on PM Modi’s mother
description: Patna High Court has ordered Congress to remove an AI-generated video from social media platforms featuring PM Modi and his late mother, Heeraben Modi. The video, shared by Bihar Congress, depicted Modi's mother criticizing his politics, sparking outrage from BJP leaders who condemned it as disrespectful and shameful.

title: Amazon CEO’s warning: Company’s culture may be at risk; needs a reset
description: Andy Jassy, Amazon CEO, focuses on improving company culture. He aims to reduce bureaucracy and flatten the organizational structure. Amazon reintroduced a five-day work week. The company plans to increase worker-to-manager ratio. An email initiative helps employees flag unnecessary processes. Amazon laid off over 27,000 employees since 2022. AI integration may further reduce the corporate workforce in the coming years.

title: ‘Aishwarya Rai runs the Bachchan house, hasn’t moved to mother’s home’: Prahlad Kakkar dismisses Aishwarya-Abhishek separation rumours
‘Backbone of economy’: Industry leaders urge Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to act as migrants face hostility after Hoshiarpur murder
'Decided not to play': How Vaishali's Chennai nightmare helped her win Grand Swiss
description: Grandmaster R Vaishali secured her spot in the Women’s Candidates Tournament 2026 by winning the Women’s Grand Swiss in Samarkand. This victory came after a challenging experience at the Chennai Grand Masters, where she faced a series of losses. Ironically, her lowered rating from the Chennai tournament inadvertently contributed to her Grand Swiss win due to tie-break calculations.

title: Terrified bull climbs atop house roof to escape stray dogs in Telangana; villagers capture surreal scene on camera

Hands tied, lashed with leather belt, kicked: Andhra woman tortured by husband
description: Andhra Pradesh police are searching for Balraju, who is accused of tying his first wife, Bhagyamma, to a pole and assaulting her in Prakasam district on September 13. The incident stemmed from Balraju's suspicion of infidelity and Bhagyamma's refusal to provide money for his medical treatment, as she is the sole caretaker of their four children.

Dipika Kakar shares health update, says she is facing extreme hair fall after liver cancer treatment: ‘Bahut zyaada gir rahe hain’
Destiny banned from Twitch: Elon Musk, conservatives blamed; income wiped out
description: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

SBI branch looted: Gang barges in, ties up staff, flees with Rs 20 crore haul
description: In a brazen heist, three masked men robbed a State Bank of India branch in Vijayapura, Karnataka, making off with over Rs 21 crore in cash and gold. Armed with country-made pistols and knives, the suspects tied up the bank staff before fleeing in a Suzuki EVA with a fake number plate.

How much revenue will Pakistan lose if they pull out of the Asia Cup?
description: Pakistan's threat to withdraw from the Asia Cup over a referee dispute could cost them millions in revenue, potentially jeopardising their financial stability within the Asian Cricket Council. This potential decision, driven by PCB chief Naqvi's criticism of the match referee, risks a significant loss from broadcast deals and sponsorships.

'Woh toh dabayenge na': Dhanashree Verma reacts to rumours of cheating Chahal
description: Dhanashree Verma, following her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, addresses rumors of infidelity on the reality show 'Rise And Fall.' She dismisses divorce gossip as fabricated and hints at revealing her side of the story, suggesting Chahal fears her speaking out. Dhanashree also declares she's currently uninterested in finding love, humorously comparing herself to Salman Khan.

title: AAI to mark Yatri Seva Diwas today
Saiyaara’s success can be explained, it’s a cinematic step-up for those who loved Sanam Teri Kasam
‘Ram Gopal Varma 2.0 is going to blow your mind’: Manoj Bajpayee on working with RGV in Police Station Mein Bhoot
Parks become classrooms as elderly in Chandigarh embrace second chance to literacy
TikTok’s new US owners revealed: American investors set to take majority stake after Trump confirms deal
Kolkata’s SSKM gets second premium ward, Mamata says Rs 5,000 for a bed that costs Rs 15,000 elsewhere
'Brain-eating amoeba' claims 19 lives in Kerala
description: Kerala is on high alert following 19 deaths from Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM) this year, with 69 cases reported. While no clusters are linked to single water sources like in 2024, health officials have heightened surveillance after the Nipah outbreak. Authorities are urging chlorination and testing, but treatment remains challenging due to limited options.

title: Trump ramps up attacks on NYT after $15bn lawsuit
description: Donald Trump has launched a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times, accusing the newspaper of a long-standing smear campaign. Filed in Florida, the suit targets several reporters, the paper, and its publisher, citing articles and a book as evidence of malicious defamation.

title: Agra: Elderly couple die as e-scooter on charge catches fire; granddaughter survives
description: In a tragic incident in Agra, an elderly couple died in a fire caused by an e-scooter that was charging indoors. Their 14-year-old granddaughter escaped to alert her parents. The victims, aged 95 and 85, were sleeping on the ground floor when the scooter's battery exploded. The son alleges negligence by the manufacturer, as the battery was still under warranty.

title: Childless woman burnt alive on cow dung pile; in-laws attack cops during cremation attempt
description: In a shocking incident in Alwar's Deeg district, Sarla Devi was allegedly burnt alive by her in-laws due to years of harassment for being childless. When police intervened to investigate, they were attacked by villagers attempting to cremate the body.

title: Lesson for founders: Zerodha CEO cites Nvidia chief; says success takes time
description: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath drew parallels between his firm's journey and Nvidia's, emphasizing the significance of timing and perseverance. Starting with a modest ₹10 lakh investment, Zerodha leveraged free infrastructure and focused on customer-centric policies like 'no spam, no tracking'. Kamath attributes Zerodha's success to being in the right place at the right time, coinciding with India's economic rise.
